title: Settings

basic.title: Basic experience
basic.desc: Language preferences, theme mode, and general settings.

providers.title: Custom Engine
providers.desc: Configure Codex / Claude / Gemini, and add custom engines (icon + startup command + isolated environment).

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.desc: Choose how CodexFlow reminds you when agents finish their tasks. (Currently only supports Codex.)

terminal.title: Terminal & input
terminal.desc: Configure input field behavior and the built-in terminal appearance.

networkAccount.title: Network & Account
networkAccount.desc: Manage network proxy settings and review your ChatGPT account status. (Account features currently only support Codex.)

data.title: Data & storage
data.desc: Inspect cached files and clean redundant histories.

active.label: Default engine
active.help: Used for subsequent new consoles / launches.

providers.listHelp: Built-in engines can override startup command and icon; custom engines can be added/removed.

fields.name: Name
fields.nameHelp: Custom engines can rename; built-in names follow UI language.
fields.startupCmdHelp: Executed when creating a new console; you can provide a full command if needed.
fields.iconHelp: Upload SVG/PNG etc; stored as a DataURL in settings. If you don't set a dark icon, the default icon will be reused automatically.

claudeCode.title: Claude Code
claudeCode.desc: Controls the filtering rules when reading session history from ~/.claude.

readAgentHistory.label: Read Claude Code Agent history (not recommended)
readAgentHistory.desc: When enabled, CodexFlow will parse agent-*.jsonl and assistant-output-only sessions. This may add noise and impact performance.

network.label: Network proxy
network.desc: Make all in-app requests follow your proxy (default: on).
network.enableDesc: When enabled, CodexFlow will proxy rate-limit checks and other requests.

language.label: UI Language
language.help: Choose the language used across the app.

theme.label: Theme
theme.help: Match CodexFlow to your workspace. The system theme is currently {mode}.

experimental.title: Experimental
experimental.desc: These features are still evolving and may cause unexpected issues.

multiInstance.label: Allow multiple instances (Experimental)
multiInstance.desc: Bypass the single-window limit and run multiple fully isolated CodexFlow instances. Requires restart after saving.
multiInstance.howTo1: Launch the app again (auto assigns an isolated profile).
multiInstance.howTo2: Start a named profile with "CodexFlow.exe" --profile work.
multiInstance.warning1: Resource usage: each instance runs its own index, increasing memory and disk usage.
multiInstance.warning2: Compatibility: in rare cases, notifications or external open may focus a different window.

terminalMode.label: Execution Environment
terminalMode.help: Switch between WSL, PowerShell 7, and Windows PowerShell.
terminalMode.pwshUnavailable: PowerShell 7 is not available. Falling back to Windows PowerShell.

wslDistroHelp: Select the default distribution used when opening a WSL terminal.
codexCmdHelp: Customize the command CodexFlow runs when launching from the terminal.

terminalTheme.label: Terminal theme
terminalTheme.help: Pick a color palette for the integrated terminal. Changes apply to every tab immediately.

terminalFont.label: Terminal font
terminalFont.help: Choose the monospaced font for the integrated terminal. The preview below updates in real time.
terminalFont.note: If a font is not installed, the terminal falls back to the system default.
terminalFont.showAllHint: If enabled, the list above shows every installed font. Otherwise only monospace fonts appear.

codexTrace.label: Codex TUI debugging
codexTrace.help: Control whether CodexFlow adds trace logging flags when launching Codex (applies to new terminals). The switch is managed by debug.config.jsonc.
codexTrace.note: Supported in both WSL and PowerShell sessions; turn this off if you prefer quieter logs.

sendMode.label: Send key behavior
sendMode.help: Decide whether pressing Enter sends the text immediately.

projectPathStyle.label: Message path format
projectPathStyle.help: Pick the path format inserted into conversations.

warnOutsideProject.label: Warn about items outside the project
warnOutsideProject.desc: Show a confirmation dialog when dragged paths are not under the current project directory.

notifications.label: Task completion alerts
notifications.help: Get notified automatically when an agent finishes its task. Alerts only appear when you switch to another window or tab, so they won't interrupt your current work.

badge.label: Taskbar badge
badge.desc: Show the number of finished tasks on the CodexFlow icon.

system.label: Desktop notification
system.desc: Send a system notification whenever an agent completes its current task.

sound.label: Play chime
sound.desc: Play a short sound when a task completes.

codexAccount.label: ChatGPT account
codexAccount.help: Check the login status synced from your ChatGPT desktop session.

record.label: Record accounts
record.desc: When enabled, CodexFlow backs up auth.json whenever it detects an account change during refresh.

codexRoots.label: .codex roots (read-only)
codexRoots.help: Reference directories detected on disk. Useful for troubleshooting.

claudeRoots.label: .claude roots (read-only)
claudeRoots.help: Reference directories detected on disk. Useful for troubleshooting.

geminiRoots.label: .gemini roots (read-only)
geminiRoots.help: Reference directories detected on disk. Useful for troubleshooting.

appData.label: App data directory
appData.desc: Inspect the current instance (profile) user data footprint and clean it when necessary. Multi-instance mode uses separate directories per profile.
appData.awaitingRefresh: Not measured yet. Click “Refresh usage” to collect the latest data.
appData.cleanConfirmDesc: This removes cached files under {path} while keeping essential preferences (settings.json).
appData.cleanConfirmNote: Caches regenerate automatically when needed. You do not need to restore them manually.
appData.notSupported: Cache inspection is not available in this build.
appData.purgeFailed: Failed to delete all data. Please try again.
appData.fullConfirmDesc: This deletes everything inside {path} and then closes CodexFlow.
appData.fullConfirmNote: The action cannot be undone. Back up anything important first.

autoProfiles.label: Auto profile directories (auto-*)
autoProfiles.desc: Multi-instance mode creates a separate user data directory for each auto-* profile. Inspect and reclaim unused directories here.
autoProfiles.notSupported: Auto profile directory management is not available in this build.
autoProfiles.loadFailed: Unable to load auto profile directory info.
autoProfiles.cleanupConfirmDesc: This deletes all unused auto-* profile user data directories (the current instance is not affected).
autoProfiles.cleanupConfirmNote: This cannot be undone. Directories will be recreated and bootstrapped from the base config when needed.
autoProfiles.cleanupSuccess: Reclaimed {removed} directories. Skipped {skipped} (busy {busy}, missing {notFound}). Estimated freed {freed}.
autoProfiles.cleanupFailed: Failed to reclaim auto profile directories.

historyCleanup.label: Session history file cleanup
historyCleanup.desc: Scan all session history files, find those with empty input/output, and delete them permanently.

cleanupConfirm.title: Delete Permanently
cleanupConfirm.desc: The following {count} history files will be permanently deleted:
cleanupConfirm.showFirst: Showing first {count} items (if more, please clean in batches)
cleanupConfirm.warningDesc: This will permanently delete {count} history files and cannot be undone. Continue?

debug.label: Debug configuration
debug.help: Manage all debug flags in a single JSONC file.

footer.note: Changes apply after you save. Some items may require restarting CodexFlow.
